content.description: Sit start in the crack as far to the right as you can. Follow the crack left until you get to the flake. Use that and the jug above it. Top out right above the jug.

Sit start on the right end of the crack. Move directly up to a pinch/small horn on the lip. Find a crimp for your right hand. From here there are two options. 1. Bump that right hand up on crimps until you reach the top of the boulder. 2. Fire that right hand straight to the top. Then an easy top out to finish it.
content.location: Start on right of obvious horizontal crack and go up.

content.description: Sit start on right end of the crack. Move out right to the best hold in that area. Left hand traces in to crimps. Work your way straight up to the top on your choice of crimps.
content.location: Right side of the boulder. Start in obvious crack (just like every other climb on this boulder).

content.description: Sit start on the arete on the left side of the boulder. Make one or two moves up until you can grab the large ledge (yes that big block under you is on). Get your foot up there and stand up over the top with an easy top out.
content.location: Left corner of the Social Distancing Boulder.

content.description: Sit start in the crack as far to the right as you can. Follow the crack all the way across the boulder smearing feet anywhere you can and top out on the left side (top out for Knock It Off). The big block at the bottom of the boulder is off.
content.location: The obvious horizontal crack in the boulder.

content.description: This lowball boulder, maxing out at about 8 feet tall, sits just under the You Must Be This Tall Boulder. The face has a lot of small chips that are flaking off which makes the feet kind of untrustworthy but it should clean up the more traffic it gets.
